recipe_name: Honey-glazed roast pork burgers with apple sauce
author: James Tanner
programme: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. Rub the oil all over the skin of the pork loin, then rub in sea salt, to taste.  Place the pork into a roasting tin and cook for 20 minutes, then reduce the heat to 180C/350F/Gas 4 and cook for a further 1 hour 20 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through and the fat is crisp. Use a meat thermometer to make sure the meat is thoroughly cooked. When the pork is cooked through, spread the honey all over it, then set aside on a warm plate to rest. Using a sharp knife, cut the crackling from the pork loin.  To serve, carve the pork into four thick slices and place each inside a burger bun. Drizzle the apple sauce over the pork and add a piece of crackling to each bun.
ingredients: 2kg/4Â½lb loin of pork, boned, rolled, and scored in a criss-cross pattern using a sharp knife,  2-3 tbsp vegetable oil,  sea salt ,  4 tbsp clear honey,  ready-made apple sauce, to serve,  8 burger buns
